content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> be a function that is defined for all real numbers <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Of the following, which is the best interpretation of the statement <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 3, of, f of x, equals 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi><mo>⁡</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></munder><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The value of the function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="x equals 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is 5.

The value of the function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="x equals 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is 3.

As <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> approaches 3, the values of <math alttext="f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> approach 5.

As <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> approaches 5, the values of <math alttext="f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> approach 3.

content.answer: As <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> approaches 3, the values of <math alttext="f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> approach 5.

topic.text: 1.2: Defining Limits and Using Limit Notation

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
